title: Calories in a Quesadilla
meta_description: Discover calories in a quesadilla, including a basic cheese version with full nutrition breakdown, macros, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard 8-inch flour tortilla with 2 oz shredded cheddar cheese, folded and cooked on a dry skillet; no added fillings or sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by tortilla size, cheese type, added ingredients, cooking method, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A basic cheese quesadilla contains about 450 calories and 20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use corn tortilla instead of flour

faqs.q: How many calories in a basic cheese quesadilla?
faqs.a: Approximately 450 calories for one standard 8-inch version.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a quesadilla?
faqs.a: About 35 g carbs, 20 g protein, 25 g fat, with 2 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does adding meat increase calories in a quesadilla?
faqs.a: Yes, like 2 oz chicken adds ~100 kcal, making it 550 total.
Yes, a basic one has ~800 mg due to cheese and tortilla.

faqs.q: How to make a lower-calorie quesadilla?
faqs.a: Use veggies, low-fat cheese, or corn tortilla to reduce by 50-100 kcal.
